meanings.definition: To move faster than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah was outspeeding the gazelle in the race.
meanings.sent2: The car outspeeded the truck on the highway.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, confident in outspeeding him.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to be outspeeding time itself as it rushed through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The rocket blasted off, outspeeding all expectations of its velocity.

meanings.sent1: In the marathon, she was outspeeding her previous record.
meanings.sent2: The new sports car outspeeded all the other vehicles on the track.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outspeeding the birds in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: His heart was outspeeding his thoughts as he approached the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The river was outspeeding its usual flow after the heavy rainfall.
